definition: passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: The Mayers have been distinguished doctors for generations. It runs in the blood.
sentences.chinese: 邁耶一家世代名醫，從醫是他們的祖傳。

sentences.english: Our shop is the ancestral manipulation.
sentences.chinese: 本店是祖傳推拿手法店。

sentences.english: According to elders who say that this is his ancestral home of the BY, and outsiders will never Chuan.
sentences.chinese: 據老輩們講，這是他家祖傳的祕技，絕不傳與外人。

sentences.english: This sword has been brought down in my family.
sentences.chinese: 這把刀是我家祖傳下來的。

sentences.english: Secret prescription containing Sino-Thai herbal ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 祖傳祕方，中泰草藥成份。

sentences.english: Due to some hereditary miracle in the people who joined the circus.
sentences.chinese: 由於有些加入馬戲團的人身懷祖傳絕技。

sentences.english: Whose ghosts scare victor kings in their ancestral towers.
sentences.chinese: 祖傳的古堡，其幽靈使得勝的君王驚悸。

sentences.english: The burglar steal some family heirloom.
sentences.chinese: 竊賊偷了一些家庭的祖傳遺產。

definition: handed down in a family/family traditions
master/qualified worker/respectful form of address for older men/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
to carry on as before/to follow (an old custom etc)
